text.p: These are some of the leading stories in Kuwait's press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Finance Minister Nasser al-Rodhan says added revenue from higher oil prices will not eliminate a budget deficit.
- National flag carrier Kuwait Airways Corp (KAC) will go bankrupt if it does not receive state financial aid, informed government source says.
- Malaysian Prime Minisetr Mahathir Mohamad arrived in Kuwait on Saturday. Mahathir, who will also visit Bahrain, is eager to boost economic ties with Gulf Arab states.
- Some 33 real estate and investment firms will participate in the Indian Property and Investment Exhibition which opens on Monday.
- MPs blast the government's economic plan in a parliamentary debate on Saturday.

- Public Authority for Assessment of Compensation (PAAC) says delays in payments was due to additional Central Bank procedures. PAAC last week announced it would transfer $11.3 million to the accounts of 4,500 people who claimed damages caused by the 1990-91 Iraqi occupation of Kuwait.
